storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to submit schedule change requests to initiate approval workflows

testCases.title: Validate successful schedule change request submission
preconditions: Scheduler user account exists and is active
Scheduler has valid authentication credentials
Schedule change request form is accessible in the system
Test document file (under 10MB) is prepared for attachment
Database connection is active and ScheduleChangeRequests table is accessible

steps.action: Log into the system using valid scheduler credentials
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler is successfully authenticated and redirected to the home dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change request form from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request form is displayed with all mandatory fields visible including: schedule ID, change date, reason, description, and attachment option

steps.action: Enter valid data in the schedule ID field (e.g., 'SCH-2024-001')
steps.expectedResult: Schedule ID field accepts the input without validation errors

steps.action: Select a valid future date in the change date field
steps.expectedResult: Date picker displays and accepts the selected date in correct format

steps.action: Enter a valid reason for the schedule change (e.g., 'Operational requirement')
steps.expectedResult: Reason field accepts the text input without errors

steps.action: Enter detailed description of the schedule change in the description field
steps.expectedResult: Description field accepts the text input without character limit errors

steps.action: Click on the attachment button and select a valid document file (PDF, under 10MB)
steps.expectedResult: File is successfully attached and file name is displayed in the attachment section

steps.action: Review all entered data for accuracy
steps.expectedResult: All fields display the entered data correctly with no validation errors shown

steps.action: Click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the submission within 2 seconds, request is saved to ScheduleChangeRequests table, approval workflow is automatically triggered

steps.action: Observe the confirmation message displayed on screen
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation message is displayed with unique request ID (e.g., 'Request SCR-2024-12345 submitted successfully') and timestamp

postconditions: Schedule change request is saved in the database with status 'Pending'
Approval workflow is initiated and assigned to appropriate approver
Request ID is generated and associated with the submission
Attached document is stored and linked to the request
Scheduler can view the submitted request in their dashboard

testCases.title: Verify rejection of submission with missing mandatory fields
preconditions: Scheduler user account exists and is active
Scheduler is logged into the system
Schedule change request form is accessible
Form validation rules are configured for all mandatory fields

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change request form
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request form is displayed with all mandatory fields marked with asterisks or 'required' indicators

steps.action: Leave the schedule ID field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without any data entered

steps.action: Leave the change date field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without any date selected

steps.action: Leave the reason field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without any text entered

steps.action: Click or tab away from the empty mandatory fields to trigger real-time validation
steps.expectedResult: Red border or highlight appears around empty mandatory fields with inline error messages such as 'This field is required'

steps.action: Scroll through the form to verify all validation messages are displayed
steps.expectedResult: All empty mandatory fields show clear validation error messages

steps.action: Click the Submit button without filling any mandatory fields
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is blocked and prevented from processing

steps.action: Observe error messages displayed at the top of the form or near the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Summary error message is displayed (e.g., 'Please complete all required fields before submitting') and focus moves to the first empty mandatory field

steps.action: Verify that no request ID is generated
steps.expectedResult: No confirmation message appears and no request is created in the system

postconditions: No schedule change request is saved in the database
No approval workflow is initiated
Form remains on screen with validation errors displayed
User can correct errors and resubmit

testCases.title: Test attachment size validation
preconditions: Scheduler user account exists and is active
Scheduler is logged into the system
Schedule change request form is accessible
Test file larger than 10MB is prepared (e.g., 12MB PDF)
Test file within size limit is prepared (e.g., 5MB PDF)
Attachment size validation is configured to 10MB limit

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change request form
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request form is displayed with attachment section visible

steps.action: Fill in all mandatory fields with valid data (schedule ID, change date, reason, description)
steps.expectedResult: All mandatory fields accept the data without validation errors

steps.action: Click on the attachment button or drag-and-drop area
steps.expectedResult: File selection dialog opens or drag-and-drop area is active

steps.action: Select and attempt to attach a file larger than 10MB (e.g., 12MB PDF file)
steps.expectedResult: System immediately validates the file size and displays error message: 'File size exceeds maximum limit of 10MB. Please select a smaller file.'

steps.action: Verify that the large file is not attached to the form
steps.expectedResult: Attachment section remains empty or shows previous attachment, large file is rejected and not displayed in attachment list

steps.action: Click on the attachment button again to select a different file
steps.expectedResult: File selection dialog opens again for new file selection

steps.action: Select and attach a valid file within the size limit (e.g., 5MB PDF file)
steps.expectedResult: File is successfully attached, file name and size are displayed in the attachment section without any error messages

steps.action: Verify the attachment icon or file name is visible in the form
steps.expectedResult: Attached file is clearly indicated with file name, size, and option to remove if needed

steps.action: Click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Form is successfully submitted within 2 seconds, system processes the request with the valid attachment

steps.action: Observe the confirmation message
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation message is displayed with request ID indicating successful submission with attachment

postconditions: Schedule change request is saved with the valid attachment (5MB file)
Large file (12MB) is not stored in the system
Approval workflow is initiated with the attached document
Request can be viewed in dashboard with attachment accessible

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to track the status of my schedule change requests to stay informed

testCases.title: Validate scheduler dashboard displays correct requests and statuses
preconditions: Scheduler user account exists and is active
Scheduler has previously submitted multiple schedule change requests with various statuses (pending, approved, rejected, changes requested)
Database contains at least 5 schedule change requests associated with the scheduler
Dashboard is configured to display all request statuses
Search and filter functionality is enabled on the dashboard

steps.action: Log into the system using valid scheduler credentials
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler is successfully authenticated and redirected to the home dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change request dashboard from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard page loads within 3 seconds displaying a list view of all schedule change requests submitted by the logged-in scheduler

steps.action: Verify the dashboard displays request columns including: Request ID, Submission Date, Schedule ID, Status, and Last Updated
steps.expectedResult: All column headers are visible and properly labeled with sortable indicators

steps.action: Review the status indicators for each request in the list
steps.expectedResult: Each request displays accurate status with color-coded indicators: Pending (yellow/orange), Approved (green), Rejected (red), Changes Requested (blue)

steps.action: Verify the request count matches the expected number of submitted requests
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows the correct total count of requests (e.g., 'Showing 5 of 5 requests')

steps.action: Click on a specific request row to view detailed information
steps.expectedResult: Detailed view panel or page opens displaying complete request information including: request ID, submission date, schedule details, current status, and approval history section

steps.action: Scroll down to the approval history section in the detailed view
steps.expectedResult: Approval history is displayed chronologically showing: approver names, action taken (approved/rejected/requested changes), timestamp, and comments for each approval action

steps.action: Read the comments provided by approvers in the history
steps.expectedResult: All approver comments are visible and readable with proper formatting and timestamps

steps.action: Return to the dashboard main view by clicking Back or Close button
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard list view is displayed again with all requests visible

steps.action: Locate the filter section on the dashboard (typically at the top or side panel)
steps.expectedResult: Filter options are visible including: Status filter dropdown, Date range picker, and Search box

steps.action: Select 'Approved' from the Status filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard refreshes and displays only requests with 'Approved' status, count updates to show filtered results

steps.action: Clear the status filter and enter a specific Request ID in the search box
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard filters in real-time and displays only the matching request with the entered Request ID

steps.action: Clear the search box and apply a date range filter for the last 30 days
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays only requests submitted within the selected date range with accurate count

steps.action: Clear all filters to return to the full list view
steps.expectedResult: All scheduler's requests are displayed again without any filters applied

postconditions: Dashboard displays accurate and up-to-date information
All filters can be cleared and reapplied
Scheduler remains on the dashboard page
No data is modified during the viewing process

testCases.title: Verify access restriction to own requests
preconditions: Two scheduler user accounts exist: Scheduler A and Scheduler B
Scheduler A is logged into the system
Scheduler B has submitted schedule change requests with known Request IDs
Authorization rules are configured to restrict access to own requests only
Direct URL access to request details is possible via pattern: /requests/{requestId}

steps.action: Log into the system as Scheduler A using valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler A is successfully authenticated and can access their dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to Scheduler A's dashboard and note their own Request IDs
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays only Scheduler A's requests with their specific Request IDs

steps.action: Obtain a Request ID that belongs to Scheduler B (e.g., SCR-2024-99999)
steps.expectedResult: Request ID from Scheduler B is identified for testing purposes

steps.action: Manually modify the browser URL to access Scheduler B's request by entering: /requests/SCR-2024-99999
steps.expectedResult: System detects unauthorized access attempt

steps.action: Press Enter to navigate to the manipulated URL
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and system displays error page with message: 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view this request' or 'Error 403: Forbidden'

steps.action: Verify that no request details from Scheduler B are displayed
steps.expectedResult: No sensitive information about Scheduler B's request is visible on the error page

steps.action: Attempt to access Scheduler B's request via API endpoint by opening browser developer tools and sending GET request to: /api/schedule-change-requests/SCR-2024-99999
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with error message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Verify the response body does not contain any request data
steps.expectedResult: API response contains only error message without exposing any request details

steps.action: Navigate back to Scheduler A's dashboard using the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully showing only Scheduler A's own requests

steps.action: Verify that Scheduler A can still access their own requests by clicking on one
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler A's request details open successfully without any access restrictions

postconditions: Scheduler A cannot access Scheduler B's requests
Authorization rules are enforced at both UI and API levels
Security audit log records the unauthorized access attempt
Scheduler A retains access to their own requests

testCases.title: Test dashboard performance under load
preconditions: Scheduler user account exists and is active
Database contains 100 or more schedule change requests associated with the scheduler
Test data includes requests with various statuses, attachments, and approval histories
Network conditions are stable for accurate performance measurement
Browser performance monitoring tools are available (e.g., browser DevTools)
Performance requirement is set to 3 seconds maximum load time

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to the Network tab to monitor page load times
steps.expectedResult: Developer tools are open and ready to capture network performance metrics

steps.action: Clear browser cache and cookies to ensure accurate performance measurement
steps.expectedResult: Cache and cookies are cleared, browser is ready for fresh page load

steps.action: Log into the system using valid scheduler credentials
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler is successfully authenticated

steps.action: Start performance timer and navigate to the schedule change request dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard begins loading and network requests are captured in developer tools

steps.action: Monitor the page load progress and observe the loading indicators
steps.expectedResult: Loading spinner or progress indicator is displayed while data is being fetched

steps.action: Wait for the dashboard to fully load and display all 100+ requests
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard completes loading and displays the complete list of requests with all data visible

steps.action: Check the total page load time in the Network tab of developer tools
steps.expectedResult: Total page load time is 3 seconds or less from navigation start to page fully loaded

steps.action: Verify that all request data is displayed correctly including Request IDs, dates, statuses, and other columns
steps.expectedResult: All 100+ requests are rendered with complete and accurate information in all columns

steps.action: Scroll through the entire list of requests to verify smooth rendering
steps.expectedResult: Scrolling is smooth without lag, all rows render properly as they come into view

steps.action: Check for any JavaScript errors in the browser console
steps.expectedResult: No JavaScript errors or warnings are displayed in the console

steps.action: Apply a filter to the loaded data (e.g., filter by 'Pending' status)
steps.expectedResult: Filter is applied quickly (under 1 second) and filtered results are displayed without reloading the entire page

steps.action: Click on a request to open the detailed view
steps.expectedResult: Detailed view opens within 2 seconds showing complete request information and approval history

steps.action: Return to the dashboard and verify the list is still loaded
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays the previously loaded data without requiring a full page reload

steps.action: Document the actual load time and compare against the 3-second requirement
steps.expectedResult: Performance metrics confirm dashboard loads within 3 seconds meeting the acceptance criteria

postconditions: Dashboard successfully handles 100+ requests within performance requirements
All data is accurately displayed without errors
System remains responsive for subsequent interactions
Performance metrics are documented for future reference

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to edit submitted schedule change requests before approval to correct errors

testCases.title: Validate successful editing of pending schedule change request
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler
At least one schedule change request exists in 'Pending' status
The logged-in scheduler is the owner of the pending request
System has access to ScheduleChangeRequests table
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the list of submitted schedule change requests
steps.expectedResult: List of schedule change requests is displayed showing all requests submitted by the scheduler

steps.action: Identify and select a request with 'Pending' status from the list
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed with an option to edit

steps.action: Click on the 'Edit' button for the selected pending request
steps.expectedResult: Edit form opens and is pre-filled with existing request data including all fields such as date, time, reason, and other relevant details

steps.action: Update one or more fields with valid data (e.g., change schedule date, update reason text)
steps.expectedResult: Fields accept the new input without displaying any validation errors, updated data is visible in the form fields

steps.action: Review all updated fields to ensure accuracy
steps.expectedResult: All changes are correctly reflected in the form

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' or 'Save Changes' button to submit the edited request
steps.expectedResult: System processes the update within 2 seconds, success message is displayed confirming the changes have been saved

steps.action: Verify the request status remains 'Pending' and workflow continues
steps.expectedResult: Request status is still 'Pending', updated details are reflected in the request list, workflow continues with the updated information

steps.action: Check version history for the edited request
steps.expectedResult: Version history shows the edit with timestamp, user who made the edit, and changes made

postconditions: Schedule change request is updated with new data
Request remains in 'Pending' status
Version history contains a record of the edit
Workflow continues with updated request details
No duplicate requests are created

testCases.title: Verify editing is blocked for approved requests
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler
At least one schedule change request exists in 'Approved' status
The logged-in scheduler is the owner of the approved request
System has access to ScheduleChangeRequests table

steps.action: Navigate to the list of submitted schedule change requests
steps.expectedResult: List of schedule change requests is displayed including requests with various statuses

steps.action: Identify and select a request with 'Approved' status from the list
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed showing 'Approved' status

steps.action: Attempt to click on the 'Edit' button or option for the approved request
steps.expectedResult: Edit button is either disabled/grayed out or not visible for approved requests

steps.action: If edit button is clickable, attempt to access the edit form
steps.expectedResult: System prevents editing and displays an appropriate error message such as 'Cannot edit approved requests' or 'Editing is only allowed for pending requests'

steps.action: Verify that no edit form is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Edit form does not open, request details remain in read-only view

steps.action: Attempt to directly access the edit endpoint via URL manipulation (if applicable)
steps.expectedResult: System blocks access and returns an error or redirects to the request list with an error message

postconditions: Approved request remains unchanged
No edit form is accessible for approved requests
Appropriate error message is displayed to the user
System security prevents unauthorized edits

testCases.title: Test validation errors on edit form
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler
At least one schedule change request exists in 'Pending' status
The logged-in scheduler is the owner of the pending request
System has validation rules configured for schedule change requests

steps.action: Navigate to the list of submitted schedule change requests
steps.expectedResult: List of schedule change requests is displayed

steps.action: Select a request with 'Pending' status and click 'Edit'
steps.expectedResult: Edit form opens pre-filled with existing request data

steps.action: Clear a required field (e.g., schedule date or reason) and leave it empty
steps.expectedResult: Field is cleared and ready for validation check

steps.action: Attempt to submit the form with the empty required field
steps.expectedResult: Validation error is displayed indicating the field is required (e.g., 'Schedule date is required'), form submission is prevented

steps.action: Enter invalid data format in a date field (e.g., text instead of date format)
steps.expectedResult: Validation error is displayed indicating invalid date format (e.g., 'Please enter a valid date'), form submission is prevented

steps.action: Enter a past date if only future dates are allowed
steps.expectedResult: Validation error is displayed indicating date must be in the future (e.g., 'Schedule date must be a future date'), form submission is prevented

steps.action: Enter data exceeding maximum character limit in a text field (e.g., reason field)
steps.expectedResult: Validation error is displayed indicating character limit exceeded (e.g., 'Reason cannot exceed 500 characters'), form submission is prevented

steps.action: Verify that multiple validation errors are displayed simultaneously if multiple fields have invalid data
steps.expectedResult: All validation errors are displayed at once, clearly indicating which fields need correction

steps.action: Correct all validation errors by entering valid data in all fields
steps.expectedResult: Validation errors disappear as valid data is entered

steps.action: Submit the form with all valid data
steps.expectedResult: Form is successfully submitted, updates are saved, and success message is displayed

postconditions: Invalid data is not saved to the database
Validation errors are clearly communicated to the user
Form submission is prevented until all validation errors are resolved
Once corrected, the request is successfully updated with valid data
